Back when i bought this game i enjoyed it very much.
I'm a killer main and i enjoyed it up until the point where the mmr started getting screwed.
As a survivor you get mmr when you escape and lose it when you die, as it should be.
But as a killer you get mmr when you even get a single kill. This makes a killer mmr grow unreasonably higher than their actual skill area is.
This is the reason that me as an ash 1 (highest tier of the lowest league) killer gets put up with 4 iridescent 1 (top league) survivors on a regular basis. It's come to a point where i as a killer am completely unable to get even 1 hook before 3 of the generators are already finished. It's come to a point where i can only get something out of it when i play scummy with face camping, there is no escape, and no one escapes death perks to get at least some kills. Worst part is, survivor groups usually give the killer 1 mercy kill to cut them some slack, at this point however it's basically tying a noose around their neck because it brings DBD to match you up with higher level players even though they're far from ready for it.
It's still enjoyable as a survivor sometimes. But because of the fact that the matches are already favorable towards the survivors and matchmaking has gone to shit nobody wants to play killer anymore and you get stuck in an insane queue. Once you do get to play as survivor you get matched up with the killer builds i mentioned earlier and are extremely likely to fall flat on your face.
Both sides are being forced to go for meta and toxic builds at this point, killers more than survivors.
This game used to be very enjoyable to play yourself, but now it only is with friends in custom games, as that's the only place where you get equal grounds.

I still play it from time to time but i cannot recommend it to anybody until this is fixed.

It's an entertaining game, but hard to recommend. It can be great fun, especially during the first few hundred hours as you learn the game (it has a steep learning curve). Later on it becomes so obnoxious it's hard to enjoy unless you have premades to fool around with. 

The devs are seriously out of touch with the community, and have proven to be incompetent at balancing and keeping the game healthy in general. A shame they are unable to even utilize the feedback they get from their own community creator team (Fog Whisperers).

The new ranking system they implemented earlier this year is utterly terrible, and pretty much everyone knows and agrees on this. It was never a good idea to begin with, but they made it so much worse by only having one ranking condition.

Also the game has a solid base of cheaters.

There is a bunch wrong with this game, but overall I still greatly enjoy it.

It would take me way too long to type out everything problem this game has, and people have detailed it much better than me, so I'll just focus on why I like the game.

The main thing that keeps me coming back to this game are the different killers and perk loadouts available. It's kind of irritating that majority of them are stuck behind DLC, but developers gotta eat as well I suppose. It's not too terribly bad if you can get the different collections on sale. 
As much as it is of a grind to get the perks you want on a character, unlocking stuff in the bloodweb is actually satisfying and makes it feel like you're working towards something. It's just a shame that this game has been out for so long that I am way behind other people in terms of perks. 

Also want to make one thing clear, this game isn't really targeted for a casual audience. When I first started playing it, I was surprised by how sweaty and competitive the community was, but now that I'm 200 hours in, I understand. This game has a lot of complexity for both killer and survivor. I still think that a custom game with your friends can be fun, but don't expect that same experience when you go into public matches. 

This game is a trial by fire for new players. It'll probably take you about 20 hours until you feel like you're getting the hang of it, and it'll be about 100 hours until you actually understand the nuances of the game and feel like you're an average player. Finally at 1000+ hours, you might actually be good.
Because of how complex this game is, the skill ceiling for it is very high. But I enjoy coming back to this game everyday cause I always feel like I'm improving and have things to learn. Also like I said, there are always new things to try out.

Dead by Daylight is a pvp game of 1 vs 4 or 4 vs 1. You co-operate as a team preforming operations to repair generators until lit up. You do this to restore power to a large door or two, and 1 ground hatch opens after everyone else leaves or your the last survivor. You can play with friends (swf) or solo.

This game is quite monotonous, but every game might be similar there's difference in play style. Some are more laid back, some don't care, some may want to preform better, but you can tell it's fun. There are licensed characters which is what drew me in. 
There's never a dull moment in the game, and although some games might have some not so nice end chat people, the majority are great.
dont get this. dont waste your money.

A lot of people talk negatively about the game's bugs, its connectivity, the balance of certain killers and certain perks, the ranking systems, and more... but, honestly, I personally really enjoy Dead by Daylight, even today. I don't see many of these bugs people talk about (the ones I do see are more funny visual glitches than major game-breaking bugs), connectivity is a problem in any online game, the game has never seemed insanely overbalanced in one way or another (every match is a crapshoot--but that's what I expected!), and the developers have been consistently working on the ranking systems to make them more fair and balanced over time.

I think this game only works best if you play as the Killer or if you play with your friends. There is zero communication in solo matches, so the real enjoyable way to play as a Survivor is with a full friend group of four Survivors communicating over voice chat. Otherwise, if you want to play solo, you'll definitely want to play as the Killer, since it'll give you that thrill of messing with the lobby and preventing them from completing their own objectives. Even getting just one kill in a match is a win in my book, since, after all, it's a 1v4.

As someone who is deathly afraid of horror movies and gets jump-scared easily, even in this game, I'm still surprised by how much I enjoy Dead by Daylight. If you're interested in this game style, or if you're a horror junkie lured in by the Super Smash Bros.-like crossover with all of these horror properties, I would definitely look past the cloud of hate and give the game a shot. Play a couple of rounds with Survivor friends, play a couple of rounds as the Killer, and you may be as surprised as I was.

Dead by Daylight - одна из лучших игр в своем жанре. Неплохая графика. Продуманные персонажи (как сурвы так и маны). Много косметических предметов. Отличная динамика игры, которая затянет вас на несколько сотен часов. Хотите пощекотать себе нервишки или попробовать себя в роли жестокого убийцу, вам сюда. Лучше играть в группе с друзьями, так у маньяков меньше шансов. Рожденный бегать по орехам не получает, ну и перки нужно выбирать с умом, некоторые упрощают игру в разы

The current event (bone chill) has snowmen that allow survivors to hop inside them to hide from killer or tank a free hit, this is very useful for extending chases and is a fun mechanic to use.

Now, what do killers get this event?
Is it?:

[b]a.[/b] A large snowball that allows killers to roam the map picking up in speed gradually 
[b]b.[/b] The ability to corrupt snowmen making them similar to the resident evil zombies, they can hold survivors in place
[b]c.[/b] 3 generators having a "Bone chill" effect in a 6 meter radius, a survivor with bone chill is easily heard by their chattering teeth and has a reduced speed until hit
[b]d.[/b] nothing  

You guessed it... its nothing. I dont know how this is supposed to be an event when one side gets a new gameplay mechanic to help them in a varity of situations whilst the other side gets nothing.

I love this game deeply but there's a good reason why killers are slowly leaving the game, I'm unfortunately going to be one of those until they get shown a shred of love.

Grind to unlock teachable perks. Grind to unlock the same perk three times (all perks have three tiers). Grind through RNG bloodweb to hopefully get the perks you want. Grind to obtain add-ons for killer and items/item add-ons for survivor. Grind some more if you want to prestige a character (not recommended unless you live in this game), lose everything, and do it all over again.

Fun game sometimes, it's just... kinda grindy. 

Know what you're getting yourself into before you buy.

It's honestly terrible for killers right now. Like many people have been saying about this game and community for YEARS, you're more likely to be afraid of the survivors because of what they pack. WAY TOO MANY SECOND CHANCES. Not to mention keys and maps. Those should have NEVER been brought into the game, they have it easy enough with their insta-health totems, toolboxes, med-kits, speed boost perks, etc. Some maps are way too big, with too many generators for them to work with like the school map. While others give them a ton of looping opportunities by which the killer isn't able to catch them. Survivors should be scared of the killer. It should be hard for them to make it out. I hardly ever play as a survivor anymore because it got way too boring. The patch for the generators does absolutely NOTHING. They wonder why there's now a shortage of killers. This is coming from someone who's played both sides equally in the past. Skill based match-making is also NOT it. Someone who's ranked silver will be matched with gold and higher. Probably won't be playing much until they fix this, it's not fun anymore. There's no room to play casually. They cut down most of the killers, many cannot make up for their lack of speed. Especially the Pig who I was grinding for a while until they patched her as well. This game has so much potential to be great but the more they listen to survivors, the worse it gets. Hence, the love-hate relationship I have with it. I also really wish they'd make it so there could be two killers in the same match with 8 survivors. So much potential...I'm just disappointed now.

A very fun game that currently has severe security issues that are being exploited. Why the negative review then? The developers have given no indication that they intend to fix it, and more than a month after the issues were first documented, there's no end in sight. It's impossible to recommend a game this mismanaged and borderline unsafe regardless of how fun it is. 

Unfortunately, until if affects Behaviour's bottom line, I don't expect it will be addressed anytime soon.

好的游戏理念，傻逼到不能再傻逼的平衡机制和对抗系统。其他的就不说了，第一制作组根本不想管外挂、微调和改档。微调更恶心，不追一会儿都看不出来。更他妈离谱的是这个匹配机制，估计是线性的想把玩家的隐藏分控制在一定水平线上，拿屠夫举例，你虐菜了一局，第二局就给你匹配高级的车队和隐藏分高的四个人类。然后地形刷的不是什么无敌板就是双lt加板子联动，硬给你恶心完这一局，掉豆。拿人类举例，把刚才的换一下。整体理念就是TMD不想让你好好玩，要么就让你掉到低端局，杀就完事，杀完就把你扔到高端局，被屠杀。什么沟八……我自认已经玩了不短的时间。我就特么只说了，这么久，外加天天看教学实践，还没法正经掌握住熟练核心的游戏，纯纯该凉。我不想说什么，T M D，什么时候制作组能把微调和开挂匹配问题搞好，我再™改这评论。
